newsitem.title: USA: Nicollet Process Engineering Q1 loss widens.
newsitem.headline: Nicollet Process Engineering Q1 loss widens.

text.p: Nicollet Process Engineering Inc said Thursday the loss of a major customer caused first quarter sales to fall and losses to widen, although sales topped an analyst's forecast of $587,000.

The company reported sales of $593,718 in the period that ended November 30, down sharply from the $967,949 in sales one year ago. Losses in the quarter totaled $370,076, compared to a loss of $142,172 in the first quarter of 1996.
The company said the year-ago figures included large orders from a single, unidentified customer.
"First-quarter sales were considerably ahead of the $359,622 reported in the fourth quarter ended August 31," Robert Pitner, the company's president and chief executive officer, said.
Nicollet Process Engineering designs and makes process monitoring computing systems for automated manufacturing.
Its shares were trading off 1/8 Thursday at 1-7/8.
